item.title: Report X-2024120665
item.description:
Report X-2024120665

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-16T12:32:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-10
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF Freight
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Operations Supervisor I Mike Husby contacted safety to report a Hazardous Spill. Mike stated that forklift operator Michael Campbell was removing a pallet from trailer 86161 that was stacked on top of a pallet containing bags of UN3378, Sodium carbonate peroxyhydrate, 5.1, PG II. Mike stated that wo oden pallet had punctured through the cardboard dunnage that was placed between the two pallets. Mike stated that when forklift operator Michael Campbell lifted pallet on top the pallet had snagged one of the bags of UN3378 and when he started to back up it pulled one of the bags out of the shrink w rap. Mike stated that the bag ripped resulting in a spillage of 40-lbs of UN3378 onto the trailer floor.

item.title: Report X-2024120702
item.description:
Report X-2024120702

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-16T12:32:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-05
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DMP WAS NOTIFIED OF LEAKING HAZMAT ON THE SD 1/2 IN DOOR 102. THE PACKAGE WAS SHOWING MINOR SIGNS OF LEAKING AT THREE CORNERS OF THE BOX. AFTER USING THE DECISION TREE AND SPILL RESPONSE SHEET THE PACKAGE WAS OPENED AND A LOOSE CAP WAS DISCOVERED ON ONE OF THE FOUR 1 GALLON CONTAINERS FOUND INSIDE.

item.title: Report E-2024120227
item.description:
Report E-2024120227

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-13T15:15:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-12
  • City: SAINT LOUIS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0540 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XSL(OLD). It was reported that approximately 1-gallon of Printing Ink released from a metal drum due to a forklift puncture. The release impacted concrete dock floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site.

item.title: Report E-2024120201
item.description:
Report E-2024120201

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-12T12:24:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-09
  • City: SIKESTON
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon of material released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum due to improperly unloading freight that resulted in the drum being damaged. The material released was RE 2k 20 Extender. The release material impacted the trailer floor and concrete dock. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 65-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.
